subject: Photography
title: The Rule of Thirds
description: A 60-second lesson on The Rule of Thirds.

hook.text: Divide your frame into a 3x3 grid. Place your subject on the intersections. Instantly better photos.

buildup.text: The rule of thirds says placing subjects off-center creates more dynamic, visually interesting compositions.

discovery.text: Our eyes naturally gravitate toward the grid intersections â€” called 'power points.' Centering feels static.

twist.text: The rule of thirds isn't a law. It's training wheels. Great photographers learn it, then break it with purpose.

climax.text: Most camera phones display a thirds grid overlay. The most basic composition tool is already in your pocket.

punchline.text: Off-center is often more interesting than dead center.

quiz.question: Where does the rule of thirds suggest placing your subject?
options: At the intersections of a 3x3 grid
